The 'last_' family of functions

Source: vignettes/last_family.Rmd
last_family.Rmd

This vignette is about the functions with the prefix ‘last_’.

Fetching the API

Retrieve market summary insights.

library(financr)

datas <- last_market_summary(region = "US")

str(datas)
#> 'data.frame':    15 obs. of  38 variables:
#>  $ fullexchangename              : chr  "SNP" "DJI" "Nasdaq GIDS" "Chicago Options" ...
#>  $ symbol                        : chr  "^GSPC" "^DJI" "^IXIC" "^RUT" ...
#>  $ gmtoffsetmilliseconds         : int  -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 -14400000 3600000 -18000000 3600000 ...
#>  $ language                      : chr  "en-US" "en-US" "en-US" "en-US" ...
#>  $ regularmarkettime_raw         : POSIXct, format: "2025-10-03 14:07:03" "2025-10-03 14:07:03" ...
#>  $ regularmarkettime_fmt         : chr  "10:07AM EDT" "10:07AM EDT" "10:05AM EDT" "9:52AM EDT" ...
#>  $ regularmarketchangepercent_raw: num  0.184 0.498 0.022 0.952 0.661 ...
#>  $ regularmarketchangepercent_fmt: num  0.18 0.5 0.02 0.95 0.66 1.02 2.78 0.35 0.34 0.27 ...
#>  $ quotetype                     : chr  "INDEX" "INDEX" "INDEX" "INDEX" ...
#>  $ typedisp                      : chr  "Index" "Index" "Index" "Index" ...
#>  $ tradeable                     : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ regularmarketpreviousclose_raw: num  6715.4 46519.7 22844 2458.5 60.5 ...
#>  $ regularmarketpreviousclose_fmt: num  6715.4 46519.7 22844 2458.5 60.5 ...
#>  $ exchangetimezonename          : chr  "America/New_York" "America/New_York" "America/New_York" "America/New_York" ...
#>  $ regularmarketchange_raw       : num  12.37 231.48 5.02 23.41 0.4 ...
#>  $ regularmarketchange_fmt       : num  12.37 231.48 5.02 23.41 0.4 ...
#>  $ cryptotradeable               : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ firsttradedatemilliseconds    : num  -1.33e+12 6.94e+11 3.46e+10 5.58e+11 9.67e+11 ...
#>  $ exchangedatadelayedby         : int  0 0 0 15 10 10 10 0 0 0 ...
#>  $ exchangetimezoneshortname     : chr  "EDT" "EDT" "EDT" "EDT" ...
#>  $ hasprepostmarketdata          : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ custompricealertconfidence    : chr  "LOW" "LOW" "LOW" "LOW" ...
#>  $ marketstate                   : chr  "REGULAR" "REGULAR" "REGULAR" "REGULAR" ...
#>  $ regularmarketprice_raw        : num  6727.7 46751.2 22849.1 2481.9 60.9 ...
#>  $ regularmarketprice_fmt        : num  6727.7 46751.2 22849.1 2481.9 60.9 ...
#>  $ market                        : chr  "us_market" "us_market" "us_market" "us_market" ...
#>  $ quotesourcename               : chr  "Delayed Quote" "Free Realtime Quote" "Free Realtime Quote" "Delayed Quote" ...
#>  $ pricehint                     : int  2 2 2 2 NA NA NA 4 4 4 ...
#>  $ sourceinterval                : int  15 120 15 15 30 15 15 15 15 15 ...
#>  $ exchange                      : chr  "SNP" "DJI" "NIM" "WCB" ...
#>  $ shortname                     : chr  "S&P 500" "Dow 30" "Nasdaq" "Russell 2000" ...
#>  $ region                        : chr  "US" "US" "US" "US" ...
#>  $ triggerable                   : logi  FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ longname                      : chr  "S&P 500" "Dow Jones Industrial Average" "NASDAQ Composite" "Russell 2000 Index" ...
#>  $ headsymbolasstring            : chr  NA NA NA NA ...
#>  $ headsymbol                    : logi  NA NA NA NA TRUE TRUE ...
#>  $ contractsymbol                : logi  NA NA NA NA FALSE FALSE ...
#>  $ currency                      : chr  NA NA NA NA ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 3
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:3] NA "USD" "JPY"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"

Or retrieve currencies and their latest ‘USD’ values, e.g. currencies with a 3-letters ISO code that begin with ‘Z’.


changes_z <- last_currencies(keep = "^Z", get_changes = T)

str(changes_z)
#> 'data.frame':    2 obs. of  20 variables:
#>  $ symbol              : chr  "ZAR" "ZMW"
#>  $ shortname           : chr  "ZAR" "ZMW"
#>  $ longname            : chr  "South African Rand" "ZMW"
#>  $ locallongname       : chr  "South African Rand" "ZMW"
#>  $ currency            : chr  "USD" "USD"
#>  $ exchangename        : chr  "CCY" "CCY"
#>  $ instrumenttype      : chr  "CURRENCY" "CURRENCY"
#>  $ firsttradedate      : POSIXct, format: "2003-12-01" "2013-01-03"
#>  $ gmtoffset           : int  3600 3600
#>  $ timezone            : chr  "BST" "BST"
#>  $ exchangetimezonename: chr  "Europe/London" "Europe/London"
#>  $ regularmarketprice  : num  0.058 0.0421
#>  $ regularmarketdayhigh: num  0.0582 0.0423
#>  $ regularmarketdaylow : num  0.0577 0.0419
#>  $ fiftytwoweekhigh    : num  0.0673 0.0444
#>  $ fiftytwoweeklow     : num  0.0502 0.0345
#>  $ previousclose       : num  0.0578 0.0422
#>  $ regular_timezone    : chr  "BST" "BST"
#>  $ to                  : chr  "USD" "USD"
#>  $ timestamp           : POSIXct, format: "2025-10-03 14:06:53" "2025-10-03 14:06:38"
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr " => USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"
#>  - attr(*, "date.begin")= POSIXct[1:1], format: "2025-10-03 14:06:38"
#>  - attr(*, "date.end")= POSIXct[1:1], format: "2025-10-03 14:06:53"
#>  - attr(*, "date.dif")= num 15

Scraping on Yahoo Finance

Some functions rely on web scraping (Yahoo Finance webpages), such as last_indices() and last_crypto() which respectively provide the latest financial values (in USD) for over 40 global market indices and 100 cryptocurrencies.

last_indices() return a data.frame with the latest financial value of major world financial indices.

indices <- last_indices()
str(indices)
#> 'data.frame':    41 obs. of  11 variables:
#>  $ symbol        : chr  "^GSPC" "^DJI" "^IXIC" "^NYA" ...
#>  $ name          : chr  "S&P 500" "Dow Jones Industrial Average" "NASDAQ Composite" "NYSE Composite Index" ...
#>  $ price         : num  6732 46750 22877 21726 6963 ...
#>  $ change        : num  17.1 230.6 32.8 118.1 54.8 ...
#>  $ change_percent: num  0.25 0.5 0.14 0.55 0.79 0.52 0.88 -1.56 0.57 -0.19 ...
#>  $ volume        : num  3.24e+08 6.09e+07 2.08e+09 0.00 0.00 ...
#>  $ day_range1    : num  6722 46567 22866 21608 6909 ...
#>  $ day_range2    : num  6741 46818 22925 21729 6973 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range1 : num  4835 36612 14784 16820 4335 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range2 : num  6741 46818 22925 21729 7145 ...
#>  $ currency      : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "USD"
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"

last_crypto() return a data.frame of 100 crypto-currencies values in USD ($).

krypt <- last_crypto()
str(krypt)
#> 'data.frame':    100 obs. of  15 variables:
#>  $ symbol                          : chr  "BTC-USD" "ETH-USD" "XRP-USD" "USDT-USD" ...
#>  $ name                            : chr  "Bitcoin USD" "Ethereum USD" "XRP USD" "Tether USDt USD" ...
#>  $ price                           : num  1.20e+05 4.47e+03 3.02 1.00 1.13e+03 ...
#>  $ change                          : num  709.73 50.31 0.037 0 75.91 ...
#>  $ change_percent                  : num  0.59 1.14 1.24 0 7.19 0.99 -0.01 -0.01 1.57 0.19 ...
#>  $ market_cap                      : num  2.40e+12 5.40e+11 1.81e+11 1.76e+11 1.58e+11 ...
#>  $ volume                          : num  7.11e+10 4.62e+10 7.51e+09 1.64e+11 4.82e+09 ...
#>  $ volume_in_currency_24hr         : num  7.11e+10 4.62e+10 7.51e+09 1.64e+11 4.82e+09 ...
#>  $ total_volume_all_currencies_24hr: num  7.11e+10 4.62e+10 7.51e+09 1.64e+11 4.82e+09 ...
#>  $ circulating_supply              : num  1.99e+07 1.21e+08 5.99e+10 1.76e+11 1.39e+08 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_change_percent           : num  94.44 85.85 468.8 0.06 96.38 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range1                   : num  58895.21 1386.8 0.49 1 509.84 ...
#>  $ x52_wk_range2                   : num  1.24e+05 4.95e+03 3.65 1.00 1.14e+03 ...
#>  $ from                            : chr  "BTC" "ETH" "XRP" "USDT" ...
#>  $ to                              : chr  "USD" "USD" "USD" "USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 101
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr [1:101] "BTC" "ETH" "XRP" "USDT" ...
#>  - attr(*, "exchange")= chr [1:100] "BTC => USD" "ETH => USD" "XRP => USD" "USDT => USD" ...
#>  - attr(*, "date.fetch")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-10-03"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi TRUE
